In the '[[2011 Major League Baseball season|2011]] [[Los Angeles Dodgers]]
season', the team was attempting to rebound from its fourth-place National
League West finish in 2010. This was the franchise's 54th season in Southern
California, since moving from Brooklyn after the 1957 season. The Dodgers
struggled in the 1st half of the season but wound up finishing with a winning
record thanks to playing good baseball in August and September. They still
finished the season in third place. Some positives included pitcher Clayton
Kershaw winning the NL Pitching Triple Crown Cy Young Award and Outfielder
Matt Kemp leading the league in Home Runs and RBI and finishing second for
the NL MVP.
categories: 2011 Major League Baseball season|Los Angeles Dodgers season
